title: This is because in a React application we want to have a single source of truth - i.e.Â all data is the responsibility of one single component, and only one component. It is the responsibility of this component to store the data within its state, and distribute the data to other components via props.

inline_content.Text: This is because in a React application we want to have a single source of truth - i.e.Â all data is the responsibility of one single component, and only one component. It is the responsibility of this component to store the data within its state, and distribute the data to other components via props.

title: In the first example, both the MyComponent class and its parent are maintaining âurlâ within their state. If we update state.url in MyComponent, these changes are not reflected in the parent. We have lost our single source of truth, and it becomes increasingly difficult to track the flow of data through our application. Contrast this with the second example - url is only maintained in the state of the parent component, and utilised as a prop in MyComponent - we therefore maintain a single source of truth.
